intro: Manniella hongkongensis, commonly known as the Hong Kong manniella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
